ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla

Class PlaybackService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla.PlaybackService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener, android.hardware.SensorEventListener, android.media.AudioManager.OnAudioFocusChangeListener, android.media.MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener, android.media.MediaPlayer.OnErrorListener, android.os.Handler.Callback, SongTimeline.Callback

    public final class PlaybackService
extends android.app.Service
implements android.os.Handler.Callback, android.media.MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener, android.media.MediaPlayer.OnErrorListener, android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener, SongTimeline.Callback, android.hardware.SensorEventListener, android.media.AudioManager.OnAudioFocusChangeListener
    Handles music playback and pretty much all the other work.

    • Field Detail

      • ACTION_TOGGLE_PLAYBACK

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_TOGGLE_PLAYBACK
        Action for startService: toggle playback on/off.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_PLAY

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_PLAY
        Action for startService: start playback if paused.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_PAUSE

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_PAUSE
        Action for startService: pause playback if playing.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_TOGGLE_PLAYBACK_DELAYED

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_TOGGLE_PLAYBACK_DELAYED
        Action for startService: toggle playback on/off. Unlike ACTION_TOGGLE_PLAYBACK, the toggle does not occur immediately. Instead, it is delayed so that if two of these actions are received within 400 ms, the playback activity is opened instead.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_TOGGLE_PLAYBACK_NOTIFICATION

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_TOGGLE_PLAYBACK_NOTIFICATION
        Action for startService: toggle playback on/off. This works the same way as ACTION_PLAY_PAUSE but prevents the notification from being hidden regardless of notification visibility settings.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_NEXT_SONG

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_NEXT_SONG
        Action for startService: advance to the next song.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_NEXT_SONG_DELAYED

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_NEXT_SONG_DELAYED
        Action for startService: advance to the next song. Unlike ACTION_NEXT_SONG, the toggle does not occur immediately. Instead, it is delayed so that if two of these actions are received within 400 ms, the playback activity is opened instead.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_NEXT_SONG_AUTOPLAY

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_NEXT_SONG_AUTOPLAY
        Action for startService: advance to the next song. Like ACTION_NEXT_SONG, but starts playing automatically if paused when this is called.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • activeSongReplaced

        public void activeSongReplaced(int delta,
                               Song song)
        Description copied from interface: SongTimeline.Callback
        Called when an active song in the timeline is replaced by a method other than shiftCurrentSong()
        Specified by:
        activeSongReplaced in interface SongTimeline.Callback
        Parameters:
        delta - The distance from the current song. Will always be -1, 0, or 1.
        song - The new song at the position

      • deleteMedia

        public int deleteMedia(int type,
                       long id)
        Delete all the songs in the given media set. Should be run on a background thread.
        Parameters:
        type - One of the TYPE_* constants, excluding playlists.
        id - The MediaStore id of the media to delete.
        Returns:
        The number of songs deleted.

      • shiftCurrentSong

        public Song shiftCurrentSong(int delta)
        Move to next or previous song or album in the queue.
        Parameters:
        delta - One of SongTimeline.SHIFT_*.
        Returns:
        The new current song.

      • rewindCurrentSong

        public Song rewindCurrentSong()
        Skips to the previous song OR rewinds the currently playing track
        Returns:
        The new current song

      • userActionTriggered

        public void userActionTriggered()
        Resets the idle timeout countdown. Should be called by a user action has been triggered (new song chosen or playback toggled). If an idle fade out is actually in progress, aborts it and resets the volume.

      • runQuery

        public void runQuery(QueryTask query)
        Run the query and add the results to the timeline. Should be called in the worker thread.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to run.

      • addSongs

        public void addSongs(QueryTask query)
        Run the query in the background and add the results to the timeline.
        Parameters:
        query - The query.

      • enqueueFromSong

        public void enqueueFromSong(Song song,
                            int type)
        Enqueues all the songs with the same album/artist/genre as the passed song. This will clear the queue and place the first song from the group after the playing song.
        Parameters:
        song - The song to base the query on
        type - The media type, one of MediaUtils.TYPE_ALBUM, TYPE_ARTIST, or TYPE_GENRE

      • clearQueue

        public void clearQueue()
        Clear the song queue.

        public void emptyQueue()
        Empty the song queue.

        Parameters:

      • shuffleMode

        public static int shuffleMode(int state)
        Returns the shuffle mode for the given state.
        Parameters:
        state - The PlaybackService state to process.
        Returns:
        The shuffle mode. One of SongTimeline.SHUFFLE_*.

      • finishAction

        public static int finishAction(int state)
        Returns the finish action for the given state.
        Parameters:
        state - The PlaybackService state to process.
        Returns:
        The finish action. One of SongTimeline.FINISH_*.

        Create a PendingIntent for use with the notification.
        Parameters:
        prefs - Where to load the action preference from.

                                                   int state,
                                                   int mode)
        Create a song notification. Call through the NotificationManager to display it.
        Parameters:
        song - The Song to display information about.
        state - The state. Determines whether to show paused or playing icon.

      • performAction

        public void performAction(ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla.Action action,
                          PlaybackActivity receiver)
        Execute the given action.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to execute.
        receiver - Optional. If non-null, update the PlaybackActivity with new song or state from the executed action. The activity will still be updated by the broadcast if not passed here; passing it just makes the update immediate.
